summary: User struggling with asynchronous child workflow execution in PHP SDK where child workflows don't start executing before parent completes. Seeking equivalent of Java's pattern for waiting on child workflow promises.
userImpact: Users cannot reliably execute child workflows asynchronously in PHP without them being cancelled when the parent completes.
rootCause: Parent workflow completes before child workflow execution has started, causing child to be cancelled due to parent close policy.
proposedFix: Use yield with Workflow.asyncDetached, or use UntypedChildWorkflowStub with start() method to explicitly wait for child workflow to begin execution.
workaround: Call yield on the asyncDetached task or use UntypedChildWorkflowStub.start() and yield the result to ensure child workflow starts before parent completes.
keyQuote: Point 4 says "Wait for the Promise returned by getWorkflowExecution to complete." - can this be implemented using php-sdk?
